lexUnit.name: amble.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: walk or move at a leisurely pace.

sentence.text: No , there was Tumbleweed asleep under an old army greatcoat , a ladybird ambling about on his twitching nose .
Kalchu cut and stripped two stalks of maize for Hārkini and L Bah and as they ambled along they chewed them like sugar-cane .
The men were ambling along , stopping every now and then for rests , biding time until their turn came round .
They ambled along the riverbank , stopping to eat a few crickets and an earthworm or two .
Ali hissed at Kate 's camel , which took no notice of him and continued to amble along the rocky bottom of the ravine .
He eased his horse round and they ambled along the ridge until the ground fell steeply away and a great valley stretched below them , a silver river sketched through it .
The little man was ambling along in the middle of the street , looking around him with an expression of keen interest .
In penance she turned her head towards the open window , searching the small groups of people who ambled along the path for a familiar face .
The unconcerned Sooty ambled away to join another group .
He sits behind a half screen , perusing the faces of customers as they amble away , their arms full of cans for the road .
She spotted us at the same time and after a long look , took her offspring and ambled away along the side of the mountain .
Finch ambled back to his point .
Now the men shook themselves off and ambled back towards their seats .
He appeared in July ` 85 , ambling down the 18th fairway at Royal St George 's .
She ambled down roads and along paths that she knew well and she failed to record what she saw .
He sighed and ambled down the corridor , whistling ` Hi-ho , hi-ho , " under his breath .
He ambled through to take a look at the machine .
The dung-collector ambled slowly over , one eye on Sir John .

No one in Brussels knew that the French had invaded ; instead they prepared for a duchess 's ball while a fat Prussian major paid for his roast chicken , finished his wine , then ambled slowly northwards .
Through the candy curtains ambles a tall , solid figure : Sean Connery .
Peter ambled after them and joined other fathers who would doubtless have to help with bootlaces .
Old folk ambled , fanning themselves with hats or newspapers , slowing down their progress .
The Rover ambled across England from east to west .

Isobel looked at the muddle with distaste , then quickly washed her hands , put a kettle of water on the gas stove and assembled cups and saucers on a tray , while Hank ambled curiously around the old-fashioned kitchen .
Crustaceans are able to amble freely among the anemone 's tentacles because their hard exoskeletons protect them from stings from the nematocysts .
As each beast ambled at its own pace along a farm track , the team collected its breath with the help of a gas-tight mask and a weather balloon .

To guarantee integrity and fault tolerance , CA has ambled down the road to Tandem Computer Inc , and is currently in the labs developing a Unicenter version for Tandem 's Guardian , fault-tolerant operating system .
Sonny ambled reluctantly towards him .
She seemed to take a fancy to a green patch further into the field and began to amble slowly towards it .
